source_sentence: 大方等無想經卷第一
translation: Dafangdeng wuqie jing roll 1

source_sentence: 北涼天竺三藏曇無讖譯
translation: Translated by the Tripiṭaka of Northern Liang and India, Dharmakṣema

source_sentence: 大雲初分大眾健度第一
translation: Mahāmegha-sūrya-prabhāsa-jñānôttara-vikrīḍitā

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在王舍城耆闍崛山中，與大比丘僧九萬八千，大迦葉等而為上首，一切皆是大阿羅漢——諸漏已盡皆得自在，其心調柔如香象王；隨順善道心得解脫，智慧無礙捨離重擔；所作已辦永斷諸有，所修禁戒、清淨微妙心到彼岸；威德巍巍有大名稱，具足成就得八解脫——皆於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面禮佛，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa with 98,000 great monks and nuns, headed by Mahākāśyapa and the others, all of whom were great arhats-arhats whose contaminants had ended and who had attained freedom, whose minds were as refined as a fragrant elephant king, whose minds were liberated by following the good path and whose wisdom was unimpeded and free of heavy burdens, whose works had been accomplished and who had permanently ended existence, whose cultivated precepts were pure and subtle, whose minds had reached the other shore, whose majestic virtue was so great that it was renowned, and whose accomplishments had led to the eight liberations-who rose from meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage to him with their heads in front of them, joined their palms in respect, circled him three times to the right, and, after paying homage, withdrew to sit to one side.

source_sentence: 復有比丘尼眾六萬五千，摩訶波闍波提比丘尼而為上首，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面禮足，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Again, there were 65,000 nuns and bhikṣus who rose from meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, bowed their heads to his feet, put their palms together in respect, circled him three times to the right, paid homage, and withdrew to sit to one side after cultivating their respect.

source_sentence: 復有菩薩摩訶薩六萬八千，一切皆是大香象王，其名曰大雲密藏菩薩摩訶薩、大雲得志菩薩摩訶薩、大雲電光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲雷震菩薩摩訶薩、大雲勤藏菩薩摩訶薩、大雲愛樂菩薩摩訶薩、大雲歡喜菩薩摩訶薩、大雲性菩薩摩訶薩、大雲金剛首菩薩摩訶薩、大雲寶首菩薩摩訶薩、大雲吼菩薩摩訶薩、大雲名稱菩薩摩訶薩、大雲願華菩薩摩訶薩、大雲施雨菩薩摩訶薩、大雲不輕菩薩摩訶薩、大雲勤行菩薩摩訶薩、大雲師子吼王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲滿雨心王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲普光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲正見菩薩摩訶薩；大雲遍雨王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲身通王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲上妙菩薩摩訶薩、大雲自在菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大海菩薩摩訶薩、大雲一切自在菩薩摩訶薩、大雲福田菩薩摩訶薩、大雲一切施安菩薩摩訶薩、大雲日光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲月光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲琉璃光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲無量賈菩薩摩訶薩、大雲常見菩薩摩訶薩、大雲我見菩薩摩訶薩、大雲淨見菩薩摩訶薩、大雲樂見菩薩摩訶薩；大雲無礙菩薩摩訶薩、大雲常勝菩薩摩訶薩、大雲淨光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲得稱菩薩摩訶薩、大雲愛命菩薩摩訶薩、大雲賈主菩薩摩訶薩、大雲順師菩薩摩訶薩、大雲現道菩薩摩訶薩、大雲護子菩薩摩訶薩、大雲勝分陀利菩薩摩訶薩、大雲火光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲波頭摩菩薩摩訶薩、大雲優鉢羅香菩薩摩訶薩、大雲威德王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲動搖菩薩摩訶薩、大雲無所畏菩薩摩訶薩、大雲多摩羅跋樹葉涼菩薩摩訶薩、大雲赤栴檀樹涼菩薩摩訶薩、大雲極深菩薩摩訶薩、大雲知善師菩薩摩訶薩、大雲那羅延大喜菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大牛王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大樹王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大法分陀利敷菩薩摩訶薩、大雲執持法光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲稱王門菩薩摩訶薩、大雲金山有德王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲無怖王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大醫王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大身王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲虛空王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲修髮王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲壞雲王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲壞風王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲壞雨王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲俾倪王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲斷闇王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲斷雹王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲迦葉菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: 復有菩薩摩訶薩六萬八千，一切皆是大香象王，其名曰大雲密藏菩薩摩訶薩、大雲得志菩薩摩訶薩、大雲電光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲雷震菩薩摩訶薩、大雲勤藏菩薩摩訶薩、大雲愛樂菩薩摩訶薩、大雲歡喜菩薩摩訶薩、大雲性菩薩摩訶薩、大雲金剛首菩薩摩訶薩、大雲寶首菩薩摩訶薩、大雲吼菩薩摩訶薩、大雲名稱菩薩摩訶薩、大雲願華菩薩摩訶薩、大雲施雨菩薩摩訶薩、大雲不輕菩薩摩訶薩、大雲勤行菩薩摩訶薩、大雲師子吼王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲滿雨心王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲普光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲正見菩薩摩訶薩；大雲遍雨王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲身通王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲上妙菩薩摩訶薩、大雲自在菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大海菩薩摩訶薩、大雲一切自在菩薩摩訶薩、大雲福田菩薩摩訶薩、大雲一切施安菩薩摩訶薩、大雲日光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲月光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲琉璃光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲無量賈菩薩摩訶薩、大雲常見菩薩摩訶薩、大雲我見菩薩摩訶薩、大雲淨見菩薩摩訶薩、大雲樂見菩薩摩訶薩；大雲無礙菩薩摩訶薩、大雲常勝菩薩摩訶薩、大雲淨光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲得稱菩薩摩訶薩、大雲愛命菩薩摩訶薩、大雲賈主菩薩摩訶薩、大雲順師菩薩摩訶薩、大雲現道菩薩摩訶薩、大雲護子菩薩摩訶薩、大雲勝分陀利菩薩摩訶薩、大雲火光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲波頭摩菩薩摩訶薩、大雲優鉢羅香菩薩摩訶薩、大雲威德王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲動搖菩薩摩訶薩、大雲無所畏菩薩摩訶薩、大雲多摩羅跋樹葉涼菩薩摩訶薩、大雲赤栴檀樹涼菩薩摩訶薩、大雲極深菩薩摩訶薩、大雲知善師菩薩摩訶薩、大雲那羅延大喜菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大牛王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大樹王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大法分陀利敷菩薩摩訶薩、大雲執持法光菩薩摩訶薩、大雲稱王門菩薩摩訶薩、大雲金山有德王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲無怖王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大醫王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲大身王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲虛空王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲修髮王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲壞雲王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲壞風王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲壞雨王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲俾倪王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲斷闇王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲斷雹王菩薩摩訶薩、大雲迦葉菩薩摩訶薩。

source_sentence: 如是等菩薩摩訶薩，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: These bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas also rose from their meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads together, folded their palms in respect, circled to their right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after paying homage.

source_sentence: 復有五萬八千梨車童子，其名曰師子光梨車、法德梨車、法羨梨車；釋德梨車、釋幢梨車、釋幡梨車、師子吼梨車、寶鈴聲梨車、愛德梨車、名貴德梨車、金剛鬚梨車、佛奴梨車、如來奴梨車、世尊奴梨車、婆伽婆奴梨車、正覺奴梨車、世尊月奴梨車、大手梨車、大精進梨車、恒河得梨車、文殊師利梨車、彌勒梨車、大龍梨車、龍護梨車、法護梨車、廣稱梨車、虛空雲梨車、恒河護梨車、金華梨車、電光梨車、大廣面梨車、性廣梨車、淨光梨車、自在得梨車、自在地梨車、地鬘梨車、方等奴梨車、金剛奴梨車。
translation: 復有五萬八千梨車童子，其名曰師子光梨車、法德梨車、法羨梨車；釋德梨車、釋幢梨車、釋幡梨車、師子吼梨車、寶鈴聲梨車、愛德梨車、名貴德梨車、金剛鬚梨車、佛奴梨車、如來奴梨車、世尊奴梨車、婆伽婆奴梨車、正覺奴梨車、世尊月奴梨車、大手梨車、大精進梨車、恒河得梨車、文殊師利梨車、彌勒梨車、大龍梨車、龍護梨車、法護梨車、廣稱梨車、虛空雲梨車、恒河護梨車、金華梨車、電光梨車、大廣面梨車、性廣梨車、淨光梨車、自在得梨車、自在地梨車、地鬘梨車、方等奴梨車、金剛奴梨車。

source_sentence: 如是等梨車——一切皆發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，守護大乘、愛樂大乘，其所教化，悉向大乘——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬畢已，却坐一面。
translation: Such chariots-all of which arouse the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, guard the great vehicle, love the great vehicle, and teach others toward the great vehicle-also rise from their meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, bow with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circle to their right three times, and sit to one side after cultivating their respect.

source_sentence: 復有四萬四千天王，其名曰愛見天王、一切愛天王、月髮天王、日色天王、長耳天王、青色天王、精進天王、深目天王、大黑天王、遠慧天王、虛空目天王、愛德天王、愛鬚天王、愛稱光天王、愛面光天王、一切喜念天王、琉璃光天王、光愛天王、半月天王、大聲微妙天王、勇壞煩惱天王、一切愛天王、童子愛天王、曼陀羅華天王、無常天王、屬昴星天王。
translation: There are also 44,000 heavenly kings named the god king of loving views, the god king of loving everything, the god king of moon hair, the god king of sun color, the god king of long ears, the god king of blue color, the god king of effort, the god king of deep eyes, the god king of great darkness, the god king of distant wisdom, the god king of sky eyes, the god king of loving virtue, the god king of beard, the god king of praising light, the god king of loving facial light, the god king of joyful thoughts, the god king of lapis lazuli light, the god king of loving light, the god king of half-moon, the god king of loud and subtle sounds, the god king of courageous destruction of afflictions, the god king of all loves, the god king of children's loves, the god king of mandaras, the god king of impermanence, and the god king of the Pleiades.

source_sentence: 如是等諸大天王——愛樂大乘、廣說大乘、護持大乘；受持一切三昧總持，惠施眾生安樂之事——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面禮足，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: These great heavenly kings who delight in the great vehicle, teach it extensively, safeguard it, maintain the samādhi mastery, and bestow blessings on the well-being of sentient beings also rise from their meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, bow their heads at his feet, put their palms together in respect, circle to their right three times, and sit to one side after paying their respects.

source_sentence: 復有三萬八千龍王，其名曰蓮華龍王、德叉迦龍王、迦迦羅龍王、惒修吉龍王、愛德鬘龍王、大地龍王、牙利龍王、淨目龍王、師子龍王、蠡聲龍王、鼓聲龍王、金光龍王、金色龍王、黑鬚龍王、持大雨龍王、大海龍王、枳羅婆龍王、梵龍王、願愛龍王、伊羅鉢龍王、陀毘羅龍王、恒河龍王、辛頭龍王、博叉龍王、私陀龍王、有德龍王、阿耨達龍王、鉢售那龍王、人龍王、非人龍王、人頭龍王、吉龍王、勳律龍王、毘舍羅龍王、蠡龍王、黃色龍王、難陀龍王、優波難陀龍王、毘樓勒叉龍王、提頭賴吒龍王、毘樓博叉龍王、毘沙門龍王、半闍羅龍王、摩那斯龍王。
translation: 復有三萬八千龍王，其名曰蓮華龍王、德叉迦龍王、迦迦羅龍王、惒修吉龍王、愛德鬘龍王、大地龍王、牙利龍王、淨目龍王、師子龍王、蠡聲龍王、鼓聲龍王、金光龍王、金色龍王、黑鬚龍王、持大雨龍王、大海龍王、枳羅婆龍王、梵龍王、願愛龍王、伊羅鉢龍王、陀毘羅龍王、恒河龍王、辛頭龍王、博叉龍王、私陀龍王、有德龍王、阿耨達龍王、鉢售那龍王、人龍王、非人龍王、人頭龍王、吉龍王、勳律龍王、毘舍羅龍王、蠡龍王、黃色龍王、難陀龍王、優波難陀龍王、毘樓勒叉龍王、提頭賴吒龍王、毘樓博叉龍王、毘沙門龍王、半闍羅龍王、摩那斯龍王。

source_sentence: 如是等龍王——樂欲聽受大乘經典，既得聞已，欲為一切廣宣分別；欲持正法，守護正法；為護法故，堅持禁戒，荷法重擔——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: These dragon-rulers - who longed to hear and accept the great vehicle sūtras, who wanted to discern them in detail for everyone after hearing them, who wanted to uphold the right teaching and protect the right teaching, who upheld the precepts for the sake of protecting the teaching, and who bore the heavy burden of the teaching - also rose from their meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads, folded their palms in respect, circled to their right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after paying homage.

source_sentence: 復有三萬六千夜叉神王，其名曰毘沙門鬼王、虛空鬼王、愛德鬼王、畢施鬼王、大瓔珞莊嚴鬼王、一向視鬼王、動大地鬼王、善毛鬼王、善愛家鬼王、摩尼跋陀鬼王、滿城鬼王、蓮花光鬼王、車輪臺鬼王、大海勝鬼王。
translation: There are also 36,000 night flying spirit kings named Vaiśravaṇa, the Sky Demon King, the Avid Demon King, the Pyuṣpika Demon King, the Great Diadem Ornament Demon King, the One-eyed Demon King, the Earth-moving Demon King, the Good Hair Demon King, the Good-Loving Family Demon King, the Manibhadra Demon King, the Pūrvaṇa Demon King, the Lotus Light Demon King, the Chariot Wheel-Tai Demon King, and the Great Ocean Victory Demon King.

source_sentence: 如是等夜叉鬼王——隨順阿閦如來道行，為護正法，受持禁戒——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬畢已，却坐一面。
translation: These yakṣa demon kings - who follow the path of Akṣobhya Tathāgata, protect the right principles, and uphold the precepts - also rise from their meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, bow with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circle to their right three times, and sit to one side after they've finished paying their respects.

source_sentence: 復有四萬九千金翅鳥王，其名曰力等香象金翅鳥王、堅固金翅鳥王、鼓聲金翅鳥王、壞一切龍王力金翅鳥王、火光金翅鳥王、斑翅金翅鳥王、輪面金翅鳥王、惡性金翅鳥王、壞和修吉龍王眷屬金翅鳥王、壞和修吉眷屬大喜金翅鳥王、實見金翅鳥王、喜說大慈金翅鳥王、法喜金翅鳥王、金翅愛金翅鳥王。
translation: Again, there are 49,000 garuḍa kings whose names are the garuḍa king of fragrant elephants with power, the garuḍa king of solidity, the garuḍa king of the sound of the drum, the garuḍa king of the power to destroy all dragons, the garuḍa king of the light of fire, the garuḍa king of the spotted wings, the garuḍa king of the wheel-faced garuḍa, the garuḍa king of ill-nature, the garuḍa king of the dragons' retinue in Vṛji, the garuḍa king of great joy to the retinue in Vṛji, the garuḍa king of true views, the garuḍa king of joy in teaching great compassion, the garuḍa king of joy in the teaching, and the garuḍa king of love for garuḍa.

source_sentence: 如是等金翅鳥王——一切無有憍慢放逸，皆得愛護大乘之心，守護一切諸佛正法——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Thus, these garuḍa kings-all without pride or dissipation, all endowed with the mind to cherish the great vehicle and guard all the true teachings of the Buddhas-also rose from their meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads, folded their palms in respect, circled to their right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after paying homage.

source_sentence: 復有六萬八千乾闥婆王，其名曰喜乾闥婆王、自在歌乾闥婆王、現在愛乾闥婆王、牛王得乾闥婆王、雲覆乾闥婆王、命命乾闥婆王、名名聲乾闥婆王。
translation: There are another 68,000 gandharva kings whose names are Śrī Siṃhala, Śrī Siṃhala, Śrī Siṃhala, Śrī Siṃhala, Śubha Siṃhala, Śrī Siṃhala, Śrī Siṃhala, and Śrī Siṃhala.

source_sentence: 如是等乾闥婆王，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: In the morning, these Turkish monks also rose from their meditation and went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads together, folded their palms in respect, circled to their right three times, paid homage, and withdrew to sit to one side.

source_sentence: 復有九萬八千緊那羅王，其名曰善見緊那羅王、長鼻緊那羅王、引心緊那羅王、妻愛緊那羅王、壞煩惱緊那羅王、壞怨緊那羅王、魔王女愛緊那羅王、壞魔眷屬緊那羅王、慧藏緊那羅王、深目緊那羅王、淨貴德緊那羅王、調根緊那羅王、遠見緊那羅王。
translation: There were also 98,000 other kiṃnara kings whose names were the well-seeing kiṃnara king, the long-nosed kiṃnara king, the mind-attracting kiṃnara king, the wife-loving kiṃnara king, the affliction-destroying kiṃnara king, the enmity-destroying kiṃnara king, the demon king's female-loving kiṃnara king, the demon king's retinue kiṃnara king, the wisdom-store kiṃnara king, the deep-eyed kiṃnara king, the pure virtue kiṃnara king, the gene-taming kiṃnara king, and the far-sighted kiṃnara king.

source_sentence: 如是等緊那羅王，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却座一面。
translation: Thus, these Tathāgata kings also rose from their meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads together, folded their palms in respect, circled to their right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after paying homage.

source_sentence: 復有一萬八千羅剎王，其名曰煮灰羅剎王、水牛頭羅剎王、黃髮羅剎王、差齒羅剎王、髑髏耳羅剎王、貪蜜羅剎王、蜜色羅剎王、大咽羅剎王、大飲羅剎王、以髮覆身羅剎王、大力羅剎王、可畏色羅剎王。
translation: There are another 18,000 Rāṣṭrapāla kings named Boiled Ash Rāṣṭrapāla, Buffalo Head Rāṣṭrapāla, Yellow-Haired Rāṣṭrapāla, Yellow-Toothed Rāṣṭrapāla, Calvary-Eared Rāṣṭrapāla, Honey-Colored Rāṣṭrapāla, Honey-Colored Rāṣṭrapāla, Great Throat Rāṣṭrapāla, Great Drinking Rāṣṭrapāla, Hair-Covered Rāṣṭrapāla, Powerful Rāṣṭrapāla, and Fearful Colored Rāṣṭrapāla.

source_sentence: 如是等羅剎王——一切皆斷羅剎之想，純以大乘調伏其心——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Such Rāṣṭrapāla kings-all of whom have ended the conceptions of the Rāṣṭrapālīs and have purely disciplined their minds with the great vehicle-also rise from their meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, bow with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circle to their right three times, and sit to one side after paying their respects.

source_sentence: 復有三萬八千陀那婆神王，其名曰象面陀那婆王、牙陀那婆王、支足陀那婆王、驢聲陀那婆王、華耳陀那婆王、寶耳陀那婆王、鼠得陀那婆王、狸得陀那婆王、鼠狼疑陀那婆王、獼猴面陀那婆王、月面陀那婆王。
translation: There are another 38,000 dānava deity kings named Elephant-faced Dānavā, Tooth-faced Dānavā, Foot-footed Dānavā, Donkey-sounding Dānavā, Flower-eared Dānavā, Jewel-eared Dānavā, Rat-dead Dānavā, Beaver-dead Dānavā, Rat-wolf Doubtful Dānavā, Monkey-faced Dānavā, and Moon-faced Dānavā.

source_sentence: 如是等陀那婆王，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Thus, these Dhāṇava Kings also rose from their meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads together, folded their palms in respect, circled to their right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after paying homage.

source_sentence: 復有七萬八千鳩槃茶王，其名曰象耳鳩槃茶王、箕耳鳩槃茶王、大肥鳩槃茶王。
translation: There were another 78,000 kumbhāṇḍa kings named Elephant-Eared Kumbhāṇḍa King, Keśī Kumbhāṇḍa King, and Big Fat Kumbhāṇḍa King.

source_sentence: 如是等鳩槃茶王，皆已捨離鳩槃茶想，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: These kumbhāṇḍa kings have all abandoned the idea of kumbhāṇḍa, got up from their meditation in the morning, gone to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads together, put their palms together in respect, circled to their right three times, paid their respects, and withdrew to sit to one side.

source_sentence: 復有三萬八千餓鬼王，其名曰電光明王、大施王、一切羨王、箭王、大海濤波王。
translation: There are another 38,000 hungry ghost kings named the King of Electric Light, the King of Great Charity, the King of All Envy, the King of Arrows, and the King of Great Ocean Waves.

source_sentence: 如是等王——悉皆愛樂大乘經典，護持正法；常為眾生廣宣分別；渴仰大乘、飢虛大乘、貪慕大乘，純以大乘以自莊嚴；常發誓願「得戒、得慧」——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: These kings - all of whom love the great vehicle sūtras and uphold the right teaching, always explain in detail for sentient beings, long for the great vehicle, hunger for the great vehicle, covet the great vehicle, adorn themselves purely with the great vehicle, and always vow to "obtain precepts and obtain wisdom" - also rise from their meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, bow with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circle to their right three times, and sit to one side after cultivating their respect.

source_sentence: 復有八萬八千阿修羅王，其名曰毘摩質多阿修羅王、富婁那阿修羅王、念國阿修羅王、淨恒河毘紐阿修羅王、利安阿修羅王、象咽阿修羅王、三角山阿修羅王、灰髮阿修羅王、大惡性阿修羅王、火光阿修羅王。
translation: There are another 88,000 asura kings named King Vimalacitra, King Puruṣpa, King Nianguo, King Viṣṇu, King Rian, King Elephant Throat, King Triangle Hill, King Gray-Haired, King Greatly Evil, and King Firelight.

source_sentence: 如是等阿修羅王——皆悉捨離阿修羅想，其心調伏，永離憍慢，無有放逸——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: All of these asura kings - all free of asura conceptions, their minds disciplined, free of pride, and without dissipation - also rose from their meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads together, folded their palms in respect, circled to their right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after paying homage.

source_sentence: 復有六萬五千大神呪王，其名曰寶持王、無盡意王、無盡財王、無礙王、不對王。
translation: There are also 65,000 great dhāraṇī kings whose names are the King of Jewel Preservation, the King of Endless Wisdom, the King of Endless Wealth, the King of Unobstructedness, and the King of Non-Contradiction.

source_sentence: 如是等大神呪王——愛重大乘、樂說大乘、擁護大乘、渴仰大乘、貪慕大乘；得大乘定、具平等行；常欲除斷所有疑心，為護正法，受持淨戒——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Such great spell kings-who love the great vehicle, delight in teaching the great vehicle, embrace the great vehicle, long for the great vehicle, desire the great vehicle, adore the great vehicle, attain great vehicle concentration, and possess equal practices, always want to remove all doubt, protect the right teaching, and uphold pure precepts-also rise from meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, bow with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circle to their right three times, and sit to one side after cultivating their respect.

source_sentence: 復有九萬九千五通仙人，其名曰那羅他仙人、銳浮羅仙人、跋彌迦仙人、善奴仙人、竭伽仙人、太白仙人、熒惑仙人、鹿角仙人、鹿目仙人、離慢仙人、婆私吨仙人、歡喜仙人、五陰仙人、劫初仙人、大雲色衣仙人、天衣仙人、憍尸迦仙人、頗羅墮仙人、龍聲仙人、有德得仙人、斷肉仙人、施一切命仙人。
translation: There are also 99,000 sages of the five powers whose names are Sage Narātha, Sage Rājapura, Sage Bhāmika, Sage Shanu, Sage Ghagat, Sage Taihaku, Sage Enni, Sage Antlers, Sage Deer Eyes, Sage Free of Conceit, Sage Vashiton, Sage Rejoicing, Sage of the Five Aggregates, Sage of the First Kālāmas, Sage of the Celestial Garments, Sage Kauśika, Sage Bālādhāra, Sage Dragon's Voice, Sage Attaining Virtue, Sage Cutting Off Flesh, and Sage Giving All Lives.

source_sentence: 如是等五通仙人，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: These five sages of supernormal powers also rise from their meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, bow with their heads, put their palms together in respect, circle to their right three times, and sit to one side after paying their respects.

source_sentence: 復有天帝釋與無量無數三十三天，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Also, in the morning, Indra and the numberless and countless Trāyastriṃśa gods rise from their meditation retreat, go to the Buddha, pay homage with their heads, put their palms together in respect, circle to the right three times, and sit to one side after cultivating their veneration.

source_sentence: 復有四天王，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右遶三匝，修敬已畢却，坐一面。
translation: Also in the morning, the four heavenly kings rose from their meditation retreats, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads, joined their palms in respect, circled to their right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after paying homage.

source_sentence: 復有舍衛國主波斯匿王，與諸小王莊嚴四兵，是諸王等——愛重大乘、樂說大乘、渴仰大乘；為護正法，受持淨戒——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Again, there was King Prasenajit, lord of Śrāvastī, who adorned four troops with lesser kings, and these kings - who loved the great vehicle, delighted in teaching it, longed for it, protected the right teaching, and upheld the pure precepts - also rose from their meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circled to their right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after cultivating their respect.

source_sentence: 復有五萬三千諸大長者，須達多等——悉受五戒，皆發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心；愛重大乘、渴仰大乘、貪慕大乘；為護大乘，受持淨戒；為眾生故，隨順菩提——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却住一面。
translation: Fifty-three thousand other great elders, such as Sudatta - all of whom had received the five precepts, had aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, loved the great vehicle, longed for the great vehicle, and adored the great vehicle; maintained the pure precepts to protect the great vehicle; followed enlightenment for the sake of sentient beings - also got up from meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads together, put their palms together in respect, circled to their right three times, paid homage, and withdrew to sit to one side after cultivating it.

source_sentence: 復有瞻婆國主，名曰月護，與諸小王——受持五戒，一切皆發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Again, the lord of Campā, named Yuehō, and the junior kings - all of whom had upheld the five precepts and had aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment - also rose from their meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circled to their right three times, paid homage, and withdrew to sit to one side.

source_sentence: 復有十六大國：鴦伽陀國、摩伽陀國、迦尸國、拘薩羅國、跋耆國、摩羅國、分陀國、須摩國、阿摩國、阿槃提國、拘留國、半時羅國、跋嗟國、首羅先那國、夜槃那國、劍蒲闍國。
translation: There are 16 other great lands: Aṅgata, Magadha, Kāsi, Kośala, Vajjiputra, Mālaputra, Pūrvaṇa, Sumer, Amā, Avanti, Jeta, Panthira, Bhadrapāla, Śrāsena, Yavana, and Kampāja.

source_sentence: 如是十六諸大國土，其中所有一切眾生，皆發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Thus, in these 16 great lands, all the sentient beings therein who have aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment also rise from their meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, bow with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circumambulate him three times to the right, and sit to one side after paying their respects.

source_sentence: 復有末利夫人與一萬六千諸夫人等，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Again, Mrs. Mallik and 16,000 other ladies also rose from their meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circled to their right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after cultivating their respect.

source_sentence: 復有一萬八千優婆夷、毘舍佉等——一切皆發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，愛樂大乘、渴仰大乘，為護正法，受持淨戒，為欲集助無上道法，修菩提道，一切皆得不退轉心，為度眾生現受女身，常樂宣說大乘經典——亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Furthermore, 18,000 Upāsikā and Vaiśākha-all of whom arouse the mind of unsurpassed, samyak-saṃbodhi, love the great vehicle, long for the great vehicle, protect the right teaching, uphold pure precepts, want to gather support for the unsurpassed way and cultivate the bodhi path, attain irreversibility, save sentient beings in the present body of a woman, and delight in expounding the great vehicle sūtras-also rise from their meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, pay homage with their heads, join their palms in respect, circumambulate him three times to the right, and sit to one side after cultivating their veneration.

source_sentence: 復有自在天子與無量天眾，現大神變、放五色光，所持諸華如須彌等。
translation: Again, there's the Āryasiṃha god and a multitude of gods who perform a great miraculous transformation, emit a five-colored light, and carry flowers like Sumeru.

source_sentence: 所謂優鉢羅波頭、摩拘勿頭、分陀利、香華、大香華、微妙華、大微妙華、愛見華、大愛見華、時華、常華、曼陀羅華、摩訶曼陀羅華；及持諸香，所謂栴檀香、花香、馥迦香，及諸伎樂；復持諸華，大如車輪；亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: They call them Upālapatra, Mahākauṣṭhila, Pūrṇa, fragrant flowers, great fragrant flowers, marvelous flowers, great marvelous flowers, flowers of love and views, seasonal flowers, everlasting flowers, mandāra flowers, and mahāmandāra flowers, and they carry fragrances, such as the fragrance of sandalwood, the fragrance of flowers, the fragrance of fuka, and music; they also carry flowers as large as chariot wheels; they rise from meditation in the morning and go to the Buddha, salute him with their heads, fold their palms in respect, circumambulate him three times to the right, and sit to one side after cultivating their veneration.

source_sentence: 復有梵天[肆-聿+累]髻梵等，無量梵俱，放五色光，其光能壞耆闍崛山所有眾生貪欲、黑闇；持種種香雜華、伎樂來至佛所。
translation: There are also Brahmā [ra-u+rei], a brahma god [ra-u+rei], and countless other brahmās who emit a five-colored light that destroys desire and darkness in all the sentient beings on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa and come to the Buddha with a variety of fragrant flowers and music.

source_sentence: 王舍大城耆闍崛山迦蘭陀竹林，其地縱、廣足一由旬；天衣遍覆，間無空處，所謂憍尸迦衣、迦陵伽衣、芻摩衣、拘銳婆衣。
translation: The Kalandaka Bamboo Grove on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa in the great city of Rājagṛha has a floor that's as long as a yojana and is covered by celestial garments, including the garments of Kauśika, Kalinga, Kuma, and Kuryapa.

source_sentence: 復敷七寶師子之座，座高百萬八千由旬；設此供已，右繞如來滿三十匝，脫身寶衣以覆佛上，發如是言：「唯願世尊，為眾生故，當雨法雨。」
translation: After making this offering, he circled the Tathāgata to his right exactly 30 times, took off his precious robe and placed it over the Buddha, saying, "Please, Bhagavān, for the sake of sentient beings, it will rain down the Dharma rain."

source_sentence: 時虛空中復出大聲：「世尊！
translation: A loud voice then again arose in the sky, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 一切眾生雖得聽聞常樂我淨，而不能解，唯願如來，敷演解說。」
translation: Although all sentient beings can hear and listen to eternal bliss, self, and purity but are unable to understand it, may the Tathāgata explain it in detail."

source_sentence: 復有無量鵝王、師子鵝王等，持諸種種華、香、供具，以用供養寶師子座。
translation: There's also the immeasurable Goose King and the Shizi Goose King, who carry various kinds of flowers, incense, and offerings to the jeweled lion throne.

source_sentence: 復有無量孔雀王、善目孔雀王等，持諸香華、微妙妓樂以供養佛。
translation: There was also the measureless Peacock King and the Well-Eyed Peacock King, among others, who brought various flowers and incense and subtle music to offer to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 復有無量拘枳羅鳥王、善行王等，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Measureless other bird kokila kings and good-working kings also rise from their meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, bow with their heads, put their palms together in respect, circumambulate him three times to the right, and sit to one side after paying their respects.

source_sentence: 復有雪山迦蘭陀鳥王、蓮華王等，持諸香、華，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Also, the snowy mountain Kalandaka King of Birds and the lotus king of lotus flowers also got up from meditation in the morning, got up from their morning meditation, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circled to their right three times, cultivated their respect, and withdrew to sit to one side.

source_sentence: 復有無量命命鳥王、無礙王等，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Measureless other bird kings and unhindered kings also rise from their meditation in the morning, go to the Buddha, bow with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circumambulate him three times to the right, and sit to one side after they've finished cultivating their respect.

source_sentence: 復有無量山王，須彌山王而為上首，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Also, there was the king of Mount Infinite, the Sumeru king who was the leader and who got up from meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with his head and face, put his palms together in respect, circled to his right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after cultivating his respect.

source_sentence: 復有香山諸藥草王、忍辱王等，亦於晨朝從禪定起，往至佛所，頭面作禮，合掌恭敬、右繞三匝，修敬已畢，却坐一面。
translation: Also, the medicinal herb kings and the king of patience on Gandhamāna Mountain also rose from their meditation in the morning, went to the Buddha, paid homage with their heads, put their hands together in respect, circled to their right three times, and withdrew to sit to one side after cultivating their respect.

source_sentence: 爾時，所有一切樹木，常出華果；一切伎樂，無掁觸者，自然演出微妙音聲。
translation: At the time, flowers and fruits always emerged from all the trees, and all the music and instruments that didn't have banners or guards touching them naturally produced subtle sounds.

source_sentence: 時雪山中所有師子諸惡獸等，慈心相視，如母如子；復有一切蚊虻、毒蟲，皆得慈心，亦如一子；諸惡鳥等，亦復如是。
translation: All the lions and wild animals on that snowy mountain then looked at each other with kindness, like mothers and sons; all the mosquitoes and venomous insects also attained kindness, also like a son; and all the bad birds did likewise.

source_sentence: 復有四種毒蛇，所謂視毒、噓毒、嚙毒、觸毒，亦得慈心；及十六種諸惡律儀，亦復如是，諸惡眾生悉受五戒。
translation: There are also four kinds of venomous snakes that are venomous in sight, venomous in breath, venomous in bite, and venomous in touch, which also attain a compassionate mind; and 16 kinds of bad forms of discipline, which are likewise, and all bad sentient beings are given the five precepts.

source_sentence: 爾時，一切大眾悉共受持清淨戒行，樂欲聽受大乘經典，恭敬大乘、擁護大乘；呵責、誹謗大乘經者，見有受持，恭敬供養。
translation: At the time, all the people shared the practice of upholding the pure precepts, desired to hear and accept the scriptures of the great vehicle, respected and upheld the great vehicle, and rebuked and denigrated the scriptures of the great vehicle, but when they saw them being upheld, they honored and offered support.

source_sentence: 爾時，大雲密藏菩薩摩訶薩，即從坐起，偏袒右肩，為佛作禮，長跪合掌白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva of the Great Cloud of Secrets rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, paid homage to the Buddha, knelt down long and joined his palms together, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此諸大眾，咸有疑心。
translation: All these people have doubts.

source_sentence: 我今欲問，唯願聽許。」
translation: Now, I'd like to ask a question, but I beg you to grant it."

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉善哉！
translation: The Buddha said, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我今能破此眾疑心，恣汝所問。」
translation: Now, I can dispel these many doubts and grant you what you've asked."

source_sentence: 大雲密藏菩薩言：「世尊！
translation: The great cloud of esoteric bodhisattvas said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩，云何修行得陀羅尼？
translation: How does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva cultivate the attainment of the dhāraṇī?

source_sentence: 云何能得大海三昧？
translation: How can I attain the ocean samādhi?

source_sentence: 云何能解諸佛實語？
translation: How can we understand the true words of the buddhas?

source_sentence: 云何得知具足法味？
translation: "How do we know the full flavor of the Dharma?

source_sentence: 云何得見微密之藏？
translation: How can I see the hidden treasure house?

source_sentence: 云何得入安隱之處，亦得覩見如來常住？
translation: How can I enter a place of comfort and see the Tathāgata's eternal abiding?

source_sentence: 云何能得如來寶藏，永斷眾生貧窮困苦？
translation: How can we attain the Tathāgata's treasures and permanently end the poverty and suffering of sentient beings?

source_sentence: 云何能解諸佛如來甚深之義？
translation: How can one understand the profound meaning of the buddha-tathāgatas?

source_sentence: 云何能到諸佛如來大海彼岸？
translation: How can we reach the other shore of the ocean of all buddha-tathāgatas?

source_sentence: 云何菩薩得入諸佛如來境界？
translation: How do bodhisattvas attain entry into the realm of the Tathāgatas?

source_sentence: 云何菩薩護持諸佛所有幻法？
translation: How do bodhisattvas guard the illusory dharmas of the buddhas?

source_sentence: 云何菩薩得如來法，得已能說？
translation: How do bodhisattvas attain the Tathāgata's teaching and are able to explain it after attaining it?

source_sentence: 云何能知一切法界？
translation: How can one know all the realms of reality?

source_sentence: 「云何得佛日身、月身、彗星之身？
translation: "How did the Buddha attain the body of the sun, the body of the moon, and the body of a comet?

source_sentence: 云何得盡如來邊際？
translation: How can the limits of the Tathāgata be exhausted?

source_sentence: 云何能得諸佛淨業？
translation: How can we attain the pure activities of the buddhas?

source_sentence: 云何逮得如來所行？
translation: How have we apprehended what the Tathāgata does?

source_sentence: 云何得佛甚深淨池？
translation: How did the Buddha attain the very deep and pure lake?

source_sentence: 云何得佛分陀利華？
translation: How did you get the Buddha's portion of the lotus?

source_sentence: 云何得佛自在之力？
translation: How do we attain the Buddha's sovereign power?

source_sentence: 云何能得諸佛財貨？
translation: How can one obtain the possessions of the buddhas?

source_sentence: 云何能見如來實相？
translation: How can we see the true characteristics of the Tathāgata?

source_sentence: 云何見佛常住不變？
translation: How do we see the Buddha as eternally abiding and unchanging?

source_sentence: 云何能得如來金色？
translation: How can we attain the Tathāgata's golden color?

source_sentence: 云何菩薩得佛法王？
translation: How has a bodhisattva attained the status of king of the buddha-dharma?

source_sentence: 云何能得金剛法身？
translation: How can I attain the adamantine Dharma body?

source_sentence: 云何得佛常身常聲？
translation: How can the Buddha's eternal body and eternal sound be obtained?

source_sentence: 「云何菩薩得到如來所安之處，而無安想？
translation: "How do bodhisattvas attain the Tathāgata's abode of peace and have no perception of peace?

source_sentence: 云何見於諸佛如來常樂我淨，而非惡見？
translation: How do you see that the buddha-tathāgatas are permanent, happy, self, and pure, and not have bad views?

source_sentence: 云何如來真實生身、真實法身？
translation: "What is the Tathāgata's true body of birth and true body of reality?

source_sentence: 云何如來金剛之身、破壞雜身？
translation: "How does the Tathāgata's adamantine body destroy the body of impurities?

source_sentence: 云何見壞身而名為真見？
translation: How is the view of the corrupted body called a true view?

source_sentence: 云何如來身不名為血肉筋骨所成立，若有如是身？
translation: "How is the Tathāgata's body not called something made of flesh and blood, sinews, and bones, if there is such a body?

source_sentence: 「云何為空見？
translation: "What is the view of emptiness?

source_sentence: 如來說法時，云何有所獲？
translation: When the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma, how does it obtain anything?

source_sentence: 云何說法時，俱聞無所獲法，若無所有？
translation: When the teaching is given, how do you both hear the unobtainable Dharma, if it has nothing?

source_sentence: 云何復得說如來真實常？
translation: How can it again be said that the Tathāgata is truly and truly permanent?

source_sentence: 云何入於涅槃，若不入涅槃？
translation: How do you enter nirvāṇa, if you don't enter nirvāṇa?

source_sentence: 云何名實語戒，若無淨穢？
translation: "What is called the precept for true speech if it's not pure and defiled?

source_sentence: 云何讚持戒者？
translation: "What is praise of those who uphold the precepts?

source_sentence: 佛法若無滅，云何說法滅？
translation: If the Buddha's teaching does not cease, how can it be said that the teaching ceases?

source_sentence: 復言法滅時多有毀禁者？
translation: What about the claim that there are many who violate the prohibitions when the Dharma ceases?

source_sentence: 如來佛性淨、上淨、畢竟淨，其性如是者？
translation: Is the nature of the Tathāgata Buddha pure, superior pure, and ultimately pure, and is its nature thus?

source_sentence: 「云何樂生死？
translation: "How do you enjoy birth and death?

source_sentence: 云何諸菩薩常說生死樂？
translation: How do the bodhisattvas always speak of the joy of birth and death?

source_sentence: 云何諸菩薩樂見如來性？
translation: How do bodhisattvas delight in seeing the nature of the Tathāgata?

source_sentence: 云何煩惱常？
translation: What are the constants of affliction?

source_sentence: 云何愛煩惱？
translation: What are the afflictions of attachment?

source_sentence: 云何復得入一切煩惱門？
translation: How can I again enter the gate of all afflictions?

source_sentence: 云何能得修一切佛土業？
translation: How can I cultivate karma in all buddha lands?

source_sentence: 云何得善知煩惱之根本？
translation: How can one well understand the root of affliction?

source_sentence: 「云何諸菩薩善能得除滅，於佛所起疑常樂我淨心？
translation: "How are bodhisattvas well able to remove doubt about the permanence, happiness, self, and purity of mind that arises in the presence of a buddha?

source_sentence: 若無疑心者，云何畏生死？
translation: If someone doesn't have doubt, how can they fear birth and death?

source_sentence: 若畏於生死，云何復樂著？
translation: If someone is afraid of birth and death, how can they still be happily attached to it?

source_sentence: 云何得佛道？
translation: How did we attain the Buddha Way?

source_sentence: 云何轉法輪？
translation: How do we turn the wheel of the Dharma?

source_sentence: 云何度眾生，知不斷佛性？
translation: How do you cross over sentient beings and know the ongoing buddha-nature?

source_sentence: 云何治魔眾，使離魔境界？
translation: How do you subdue the masses of Māra and free them from the Māra realm?

source_sentence: 云何度眾生生死大苦海？
translation: "How will it save sentient beings from the great ocean of suffering of birth and death?

source_sentence: 云何說生死，示導生死道？
translation: "How do you explain birth and death and show the way to birth and death?

source_sentence: 云何得生死無量之大海？
translation: "How can we attain the great ocean of the infinity of birth and death?

source_sentence: 云何求生死渴仰生死道？
translation: "How do you seek birth and death and long for the path of birth and death?

source_sentence: 云何貪生死，悋惜不放捨？
translation: How do you crave birth and death, cherish it, and not let go of it?

source_sentence: 云何開生死猶如分陀利？
translation: "How is the opening of birth and death like a parthenon?

source_sentence: 云何煩惱結猶如四大海？
translation: "How are the bonds of affliction like the four great oceans?

source_sentence: 云何諸煩惱常起如發願？
translation: "How are the afflictions always produced as the vow is made?

source_sentence: 「云何而得地獄之心？
translation: "How did you attain the mind of hell?

source_sentence: 云何常求地獄之心？
translation: "What is the mind that always seeks hell?

source_sentence: 云何修集地獄戒禁？
translation: What are the precepts and prohibitions of the hell of cultivation?

source_sentence: 云何滋息地獄業行、地獄之身？
translation: How do they nourish hellish karmic activity and hell bodies?

source_sentence: 刀劍、弓箭、錐銏、輪火，云何能破壞眾生地獄果？
translation: How can swords, bows, arrows, skulls, and wheel fire destroy the fruit of hell for sentient beings?

source_sentence: 云何為地獄眾生作安樂？
translation: "How do you create well-being for sentient beings in hell?

source_sentence: 云何注大雨能滅地獄火？
translation: How can pouring a great rain extinguish the fires of hell?

source_sentence: 云何處地獄而不受其報？
translation: How do you go to hell and not receive its retribution?

source_sentence: 云何為地獄而作船導師？
translation: How do you build a boat guide for hell?

source_sentence: 云何為地獄而作大良藥？
translation: "How do you make great medicine for hell?

source_sentence: 云何而能得閉塞地獄道？
translation: How can one attain the hellish path of the shut-off land?

source_sentence: 「云何作慧燈，壞於生死闇？
translation: "How do you create a lamp of wisdom that destroys the darkness of birth-and-death?

source_sentence: 云何在生死，煩惱毒不污？
translation: "How are the poisons of affliction not defiled in birth and death?

source_sentence: 雖住無所住，而不同空住；能消諸煩惱，猶如日照雪；見於如來，常樂我淨；其心安住，如須彌山；不動不轉，如帝釋幢；如來實不，畢竟涅槃；亦說如來入於涅槃，其心不壞猶如金剛。
translation: Although he abides in nothing, he doesn't abide in emptiness; he vanishes the afflictions like a sun shining on snow; he sees the Tathāgata as always happy, self pure; his mind is stably abiding like Mount Sumeru; he doesn't move or evolve like the banner of Indra; the Tathāgata really isn't, but he eventually attains nirvāṇa; it's also said that when the Tathāgata enters nirvāṇa, his mind doesn't break down like adamantine.

source_sentence: 「云何得慚愧？
translation: "How does it attain shame?

source_sentence: 云何得好身？
translation: How do we get a good body?

source_sentence: 云何復能得眾所愛敬身？
translation: "How can one again attain a body that is loved by all?

source_sentence: 云何得不貪？
translation: How can we not crave it?

source_sentence: 云何得不瞋？
translation: How can one not be angry?

source_sentence: 云何能得微妙光明？
translation: How can subtle light be attained?

source_sentence: 云何得正性？
translation: How was the correct nature attained?

source_sentence: 云何得自在？
translation: How do we attain mastery?

source_sentence: 「云何能得大眾眷屬？
translation: "How can one attain a large following?

source_sentence: 云何能得不壞眷屬？
translation: How can I attain indestructible dependents?

source_sentence: 不退、不失，不貪飲食；常修知足，終不食肉；於諸眾生，常生愛心；常為世間之所恭敬，得名一切大施之主；得名大力，得名健行；大慈、大悲、大捨、大喜、大慧總持，隨順世間、為安世間、為樂世間。
translation: They don't retrogress or lose heart, don't crave food and drink, always cultivate contentment, and never eat meat, always have craving for sentient beings, are always honored by the world, and are called the lord of all great gifts, are named Vigorous and Sturdy Conduct, and are disciplined by great kindness, compassion, equanimity, joy, and wisdom, which accord with the world, make it peaceful, and bring joy to the world.

source_sentence: 「云何而得世間無上、世間無勝、世間無邊？
translation: "How can it be that the world is unsurpassed, the world is unsurpassed, and the world is unlimited?

source_sentence: 常行正語，修行梵行；行大悲行，喜行聖行；見空法界，隨順而說；見不空界，說亦如是；說佛法相，見佛真法；得淨自在持戒之財，德財、法財、不食之財，為貧眾生得財藏身。
translation: He always conducts himself in a correct speech, cultivates the religious practice, practices with great compassion, and rejoices in the practice of noble behavior; follows the view of the empty Dharma realm and teaches it; sees the nonempty realm and teaches it likewise; teaches the characteristics of the Buddha's teaching and sees the Buddha's true teaching; attains the wealth of pure and unimpeded observance of precepts, the wealth of virtue, the wealth of the Dharma, and the wealth of non-food, and attains the body of a wealth store for poor sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「為諸眾生得三種定，空無相願；欲生淨土，得隨願身；雖為眾生受此陰身，不於眾生求其恩報；讚歎持戒，呵破戒者；不為群邪之所沮壞；雖讀外典，不隨其義，其所說法，句義不斷。
translation: "He attains the three kinds of concentration for sentient beings, vows for emptiness and signlessness, attains the body of the vow that follows when he desires to be born in the Pure Land, doesn't seek the reward of kindness from sentient beings even though he accepts this aggregate body for them, praises adherents of morality and rebuffs those who break it, doesn't let groups of evildoers discourage him, and doesn't follow the meanings of external scriptures even though he reads them, and his teaching is uninterrupted in its phrasing and meaning.

source_sentence: 「雖名沙門及婆羅門，終不生於沙門之想、婆羅門想；雖復曉了算數、呪術，心初未曾有貪著想；雖為眾生示入天寺，供養恭敬依止禮拜，而其內心常依法界。
translation: "Although he's called an ascetic or a brāhmaṇa, he never gives rise to ascetic or brāhmaṇa conceptions; although he knows how to count and recite a spell, his mind has never been attached to them in the first place; although he shows sentient beings into a celestial temple and venerates them with offerings and respect, his inner mind always follows the Dharma realm.

source_sentence: 「現行十惡，實是梵行，諸佛護念，如視一子；善能護持諸佛法身，能轉一切諸佛法輪，深見諸佛甚深法界及真實相；其所修行等諸佛行，得無量身及無量行；善解諸佛所有語密，除去憍慢猶如諸佛；善說法界深密之義，雖說憍慢，無憍慢想，亦不教他生於憍慢；心無貪恚、愚癡、怖畏，猶如諸佛；其行無量，微密無量，諸法無量，樂說無量，性相無量，真實無量；見真、見實、見性、見法。
translation: 「現行十惡，實是梵行，諸佛護念，如視一子；善能護持諸佛法身，能轉一切諸佛法輪，深見諸佛甚深法界及真實相；其所修行等諸佛行，得無量身及無量行；善解諸佛所有語密，除去憍慢猶如諸佛；善說法界深密之義，雖說憍慢，無憍慢想，亦不教他生於憍慢；心無貪恚、愚癡、怖畏，猶如諸佛；其行無量，微密無量，諸法無量，樂說無量，性相無量，真實無量；見真、見實、見性、見法。

source_sentence: 「為諸眾生斷煩惱故，而演說法，常得知見諸佛世尊，永度煩惱諸結大海；為度眾生故，說度煩惱諸結海法，自得度、已度、未度者，自得脫、已脫、未脫者，自得安、已安、未安者，未涅槃者，令得涅槃。
translation: "He speaks Dharma for the sake of ending the afflictions of sentient beings, always knowing and seeing the buddhas and honored ones, permanently liberating them from the great ocean of afflictive bonds; he teaches the Dharma of liberating sentient beings from the ocean of afflictive bonds for the sake of liberating them, liberating those who have liberated themselves and those who have liberated themselves and those who have not yet liberated themselves, making nirvāṇa possible for those who have attained peace and those who have attained peace and those who have not yet attained nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 「自見法界，了了真實；或為眾生，說實不實。
translation: "He sees the Dharma realm for himself and fully understands its reality, or he might explain for sentient beings what's real and what's not real.

source_sentence: 於無量劫已壞四魔，為眾生故，現處道樹，方降魔眾。
translation: After destroying the four Māras for measureless eons, he now stands in the tree of the Way for the sake of sentient beings, and he subdues the Māras in this way.

source_sentence: 內實知見，久破諸魔，為眾生故，唱言今壞。
translation: With true inner knowing and insight, he has long since defeated the Māras and, for the sake of sentient beings, he sings that he's now defeated them.

source_sentence: 以善方便轉於法輪，以善方便現入涅槃。
translation: With good skillful means, he turns the wheel of the Dharma and enters nirvāṇa now with good skillful means.

source_sentence: 「云何能得諸佛神通？
translation: "How can I attain the Buddha's supernormal powers?

source_sentence: 云何得佛如來法王？
translation: "How did the Buddha, the Tathāgata, become king of the Dharma?

source_sentence: 云何得佛微密法藏？
translation: How can we obtain the Buddha's treasury of subtle and esoteric teachings?

source_sentence: 云何得佛不可思議？
translation: How did the Buddha attain inconceivability?

source_sentence: 云何能得諸佛無量、無稱、無數、無勝、無邊？
translation: How can one attain the buddhas' immeasurability, indescribability, incalculability, invincibility, and limitlessness?

source_sentence: 云何能施一切眾生甘露法味？」
translation: How can you give the taste of the nectar of the Dharma to all sentient beings?"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告大雲密藏菩薩言：「善哉善哉！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the Mahāmegha-sūtra Bodhisattva, saying, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今所問，甚為快善。
translation: What you're asking now is very pleasant and good.

source_sentence: 為欲安樂世間眾生，故發斯問。
translation: You've asked this question because you want to bring comfort to sentient beings in the world.

source_sentence: 一切眾生，無明所盲，而不能知諸佛所有真實功德。
translation: All sentient beings are blinded by ignorance, and they can't know the true merits of the buddhas.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今欲令一切眾生，悉得智慧眼、常眼、常光，永度生死煩惱大河，了知諸佛菩提之行；欲壞眾生無明結[穀-禾+卵]，示導無上菩提之行。
translation: "Now, you want to cause all sentient beings to attain the eye of wisdom, the eye of permanence, and the light of permanence, to permanently cross the great river of the afflictions of birth-and-death, and to understand the buddha's practice of enlightenment; you want to destroy the bonds of ignorance [grain - grain + egg] in sentient beings and show them the practice of unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 一切眾生，常樂演說無常、無我、無樂、無淨；而今欲開常樂我淨，如來畢竟入於涅槃，無常、無我、無樂、無淨；而今欲開諸佛世尊不畢竟滅，常住不變。
translation: All sentient beings are always delighted to discuss impermanence, selflessness, bliss, and impurity; now, I want to reveal that permanence, bliss, self, and purity are the Tathāgata's final entry into nirvāṇa, which is impermanent, selfless, blissful, and impure; and now, I want to reveal that the world-honored buddhas don't cease to exist, but are eternally abiding and unchanging.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 一切眾生，常於法界，妄生分別；而法界性，實無分別。
translation: All sentient beings are constantly and falsely discriminated in the Dharma realm, but the nature of the Dharma realm is really without discrimination.

source_sentence: 汝今欲問無分別義，是故發問。
translation: Now, you want to ask about the meaning of nondiscrimination, so you've asked this question.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 一切眾生，常為邪毒之所塗染，如來世尊為大良醫，汝意欲令如來醫王說呪、授藥，療其所苦。
translation: All sentient beings are constantly stained by harmful poisons, and the Tathāgata World Honored One is a great doctor.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 如遮羅迦梵志及尼乾子諸婆羅門，實非羅漢作羅漢想，非聖聖想，非天天想；實非常樂我淨之法，而作常樂我淨之想。
translation: "Such Brahmā Cālaka and the Nirgrantha priests are really not arhats who conceptualize as arhats, not noble and holy beings, and not everyday beings who really conceptualize as permanent and self-perfect even though they don't possess the Dharma of permanence and self-purity.

source_sentence: 汝今欲為如是眾生拔邪毒箭，解邪縛、破邪獄、出邪網，施法味、食甘露；安寢四禪，塗淨戒香。
translation: Now, you want to remove an evil poison arrow, free evil bonds, break evil hells, escape evil webs, give the taste of the Dharma and eat nectar, sleep peacefully in the four meditation heavens, and apply the scent of pure precepts for such sentient beings.

source_sentence: 四等為華，慚愧為衣，故發此問。
translation: These four qualities are flowers, and modesty is their robe; therefore, I've asked this question.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 一切眾生不知總相，不知別相。
translation: "All sentient beings don't know the general form and don't know the specific form.

source_sentence: 相、無相，非相、非無相，非相相、非無相相；不可知、非不可知；非此、非彼，非手、非指，非此、彼、中；非作、非不作，非示、非不示，非因、非不因，非瞬、非不瞬；非知、非智知，非識、非識識；非住、非不住，非闇、非明，非相、非名，非輕、非重，非羸、非力，非處、非不處，非淨、非不淨；非有為、非無為，非有、非無，非可說、非不可說；非取、非捨，不生、不退；非實、非虛，非正、非邪；非畢竟、非不畢竟，非福田、非不福田，非時、非不時，非可淨、非不可淨，非作、非能作；非生、非滅，非冷、非熱；非陰入界，非結因、非業因，非生、非墮，非長、非增長；非有墮落，畢竟無墮；非是有法，永斷諸有；非過去，非未來，非現在；非實、非不實，非性、非不性；非色，非受、想、行、識；非盡、非不盡，亦不可盡；非等、非無等，亦無與等；非地、水、火、風。
translation: 相、無相，非相、非無相，非相相、非無相相；不可知、非不可知；非此、非彼，非手、非指，非此、彼、中；非作、非不作，非示、非不示，非因、非不因，非瞬、非不瞬；非知、非智知，非識、非識識；非住、非不住，非闇、非明，非相、非名，非輕、非重，非羸、非力，非處、非不處，非淨、非不淨；非有為、非無為，非有、非無，非可說、非不可說；非取、非捨，不生、不退；非實、非虛，非正、非邪；非畢竟、非不畢竟，非福田、非不福田，非時、非不時，非可淨、非不可淨，非作、非能作；非生、非滅，非冷、非熱；非陰入界，非結因、非業因，非生、非墮，非長、非增長；非有墮落，畢竟無墮；非是有法，永斷諸有；非過去，非未來，非現在；非實、非不實，非性、非不性；非色，非受、想、行、識；非盡、非不盡，亦不可盡；非等、非無等，亦無與等；非地、水、火、風。

source_sentence: 「一切法界，實無有身；實相之相，畢竟真實，是名如來。
translation: "All realms of reality really have no body, and the marks of reality are ultimately real, which is called the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 無量無邊、不可思議諸大功德之所成就，如是身者，即是諸佛真法身也，其義甚深，不可思議。
translation: Such a body, which is the true Dharma body of the buddhas, is the result of measureless, limitless, and unfathomably great virtues, and its meaning is too profound to contemplate.

source_sentence: 如來法界，深邃幽遠，不移本處宣說正法，十方諸佛皆得聞知。
translation: The Tathāgata's Dharma realm is so profound and remote that he doesn't move from his original location to proclaim the right teaching, which can be heard by buddhas in ten directions.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如來自在神力行故，如是深語，聲聞、緣覺所不得聞。
translation: Because of the Tathāgata's unimpeded miraculous power, such profound words can't be heard by śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 諸佛何故不為彼說，令彼得聞？
translation: Why don't the buddhas teach for them and make Peter hear?

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 聲聞、緣覺乃至不解一字之義，猶如生盲，飲毒狂人；如蠶處繭，如被毒箭，如病痰飲；是故諸佛不為說之。
translation: śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas who don't understand the meaning of a single word are like blind men in birth or crazy people who drink poison, like silkworms in cocoons, like poisoned arrows, and like sick people who drink phlegm; therefore, the buddhas don't teach it for them.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 一切眾生，常為諸結煩惱所病，諸佛如來能施法藥，以妙呪術拔其毒箭、除其膚翳，眾生真實不知如來常住不變，如來為然智慧法燈，悉令得見常樂我淨。
translation: All sentient beings are constantly sickened by the afflictions of bonds, and the Tathāgatas are able to administer Dharma medicine and remove their poisoned arrows and skin blindness with wonderful spells.

source_sentence: 譬如日出，悉令眾生普見大地高下等相；如來亦爾，一切眾生，不知方等，亦不能得總持三昧，不知佛時，不知佛財，不見佛身，不解如來涅槃之相，不知佛法滅與不滅，而言如來無常、無樂、無我、無淨，有煩惱箭，是雜毒食，是故我為如是等人，演說諸佛常樂我淨，欲除此人無明黑闇。
translation: It's like the sunrise, which universally causes sentient beings to see the earth's height and level, and so it is with the Tathāgata. All sentient beings don't know the direction and level, can't attain the samādhi of mastery, don't know the Buddha's timing, don't know the Buddha's wealth, don't see the Buddha's body, don't understand the Tathāgata's characteristics of nirvāṇa, don't know the cessation or non-cessation of the Buddha's teaching, and say that the Tathāgata is impermanent, unhappy, without self, and without purity, and has arrows of affliction, which is a mixed poison food.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 善哉善哉！
translation: Bravo, bravo!

source_sentence: 聲聞、緣覺未曾得聞是一字義，汝今欲令彼得聞，故發是問。
translation: śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas have never heard the meaning of this single word, and now you want to make Peter hear it, so you've asked this question.

source_sentence: 諦聽諦聽！
translation: Listen closely, listen closely!

source_sentence: 善思念之！
translation: Think of it well!

source_sentence: 吾今為汝分別解說。
translation: Now, I'll explain it for you in separate chapters.

source_sentence: 有大方等甘露經王，開大寶藏賑給貧窮，啟發諸佛功德之藏。
translation: "There's the great king of the ambrosia scriptures, which opens a great treasury to relieve the poor and reveal the treasury of the buddhas' merits.

source_sentence: 一切眾生皆有佛性，其性無盡，昔來隱蔽，今欲顯示。
translation: All sentient beings have buddha-natures, which are inexhaustible and have been concealed in the past but now want to reveal them.

source_sentence: 諸佛如來，然大慧燈，令諸眾生，了了明見。
translation: The buddha-tathāgatas then give rise to the great lamp of wisdom, so that all sentient beings will see it clearly.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 吾將欲說，汝便發問，副汝昔來所發誓願。」
translation: I was about to explain it, so you asked a question, in keeping with the vow you made in the past."

source_sentence: 大雲密藏菩薩摩訶薩言：「世尊！
translation: The great cloud of esoteric bodhisattvas and great mahāsattvas said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從昔來實無此願，乃是世尊大慈愍事神通力故，為度眾生令我發問，欲破眾生貧窮困苦，令諸眾生意無盡故。
translation: I really haven't had this vow since the distant past, but it was because of the Bhagavān's great compassionate ministry and supernormal powers that he caused me to ask this question in order to save sentient beings, wanting to break the poverty and hardship of sentient beings, and cause all sentient beings to work endlessly.

source_sentence: 如來今說，則能消滅一切眾生無明大闇，得智慧寶，令諸眾生明見佛性，得見如來常樂我淨。」
translation: As the Tathāgata now explains, it will extinguish the great darkness of ignorance in all sentient beings and obtain the treasure of wisdom, so that sentient beings will clearly see the buddha-nature and attain a vision of the Tathāgata's eternal bliss and self-purity."

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉善哉！
translation: The Buddha said, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今所問，其義甚深。
translation: What you're asking now has a profound meaning.

source_sentence: 為度眾生生死海故，為廣流布方等經故，為常法故，惠施一切甘露法味，除斷眾生貧窮苦故。
translation: It's for the sake of saving sentient beings from the ocean of birth and death, for the sake of widely disseminating the vaipulya sūtras, for the sake of the eternal Dharma, for the sake of bestowing the taste of all sweet dharmas, and for the sake of ending the suffering of sentient beings in poverty.

source_sentence: 諦聽諦聽！
translation: Listen closely, listen closely!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說，令諸眾生得安樂故；汝今當為一切眾生善持是義。
translation: I will explain it for you discriminatingly so that sentient beings may attain well-being; now, you must well maintain this meaning for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 一切如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊等，有一法名曰法界；以此法界，諸佛世尊等有常慧，以常慧水，淨自洗浴，服甘露味，并以惠施一切眾生，修集一切諸佛所行，汝今當服是甘露味。
translation: "All tathāgatas, worshipful offerings, correct universal knowledge, perfected in knowledge and conduct, well gone, worldly savers, unsurpassed persons, disciplined beings, teachers of gods and humans, buddhas, and world-honored ones have a single dharma called the Dharma realm, and from this Dharma realm, the buddhas and world-honored ones have the wisdom of permanence, wash themselves purely with the water of permanent wisdom, take the taste of ambrosia, and give it as a benefit to all sentient beings and cultivate all the practices of the buddhas, which you should now take as the taste of ambrosia.

source_sentence: 汝既服已，復當轉施。
translation: Once you've taken it, you'll also give it back.

source_sentence: 我今當說，汝便善聽，初語亦善、中語亦善、後語亦善，其義真實，言辭巧妙，其音清淨，純一無雜，具足清白梵行之相。
translation: Now, I will explain it, and you will listen well; the first speech will be good, the middle speech will be good, and the last speech will be good; its meaning will be true, its words will be skillful, and its voice will be pure, unitary, and unadulterated, replete with the characteristics of a pure and white religious practice.

source_sentence: ◎大方等無想經卷第一
translation: *Mahāmegha-sūtra, Vol. 1
